job_title: Tutor in Milton Keynes, England
pros: Very supportive teaching team who come from a wide range of vocational backgrounds. Easy to access the two main campus sites, free parking, choice of refectories, creche at Chaffron Way and reduced membership of health suite.
cons: Mixed messages about policies and procedures resulting in confusion and ineffective use of time and resources. Poor quality of IT services for employees and students. Inadequate provision of accurate data systems. Lack of investment in vocational areas and resources. Generic compulsory CPD rather than specific and differentiated development opportunities.

job_title: Teacher in Milton Keynes, England
pros: 7 weeks annual leave!! Free parking, can access facilities at the college eg hair, beauty, restaurant.
cons: completely useless communication between college management and off site teachers. NO promotion prospects unless into management. Lots of expectations and meetings during lunch breaks - facilities poor, lots of empty promises made, emails not responded to, you really need to be out of work to take a job at the college - then work your socks off for nothing.

review_title: Three years, three jobs, three complete disappointments
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Milton Keynes, England
pros: It's local, free parking, decent holiday, reasonable employee benefits and pension... I'm struggling to fill the minimum 20 word requirement!
cons: Constant rounds of redundancies, lower than low staff morale, huge inter-departmental divisions and bad feeling, half hour lunches, no respect from students, little to no support from management, expectation to answer e-mails at evenings and weekends, I could go on...

review_title: Good Staff Benefits - Chaotic and Underpaid Environment
job_title: Esol Teacher in Milton Keynes, England
pros: Student card, pension and a socially-responsible role.
cons:
Systems tend to come before people.  High paperwork and bureaucracy demands leave little time for planning and preparing for teaching.

The pay is inadequate and the prospects for development are limited.

Management is unsupportive due to being overstretched, also bearing heavy paperwork and IT demands.

review_title: GREAT PLACE TO WORK..AND BIG PLANS...
job_title: in Milton Keynes, England
pros: Really supportive environment.  Good team work and a motivated workforce.  Ambitious changes already taking place to further improve so feels like a good place to be..
cons: Needs to have better processes.  Need to deliver on promises.  Better communication

job_title: in Aylesbury, England
pros: Finish early on a Friday
cons: Chaotic working with the confines of a prison security.  If there's a quicker way of doing something it isn't done!  Unnecessary amounts of paperwork.  Very few computer/laptop facilities for staff.  You lucky to get a table in the staff room so do not expect to be able to make resources!

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Milton Keynes, England
pros: For me it was location and the promises I was made but sadly the promises were empty and never actually happened.
cons: Empty promises, infighting and mutual distrust between departments. Expected to answer emails in evenings and attend weekend events that were for the glorification of those at a higher level but made no impact, as far as I could see, on students.

review_title: Great classroom facilities/technology coupled with dedicated hardworking TSAs.
